CINE_PowerCutscene.synopsis: This is a pure cutscene cinematic dialog. After player activates the main generator in Arcane Tower by placing a Sussur Flower in it, there should be a camera flyover showing how all the tower teleport platforms activate, lights turn on, etc.This dialog can be easily triggered from console with    SetGlobalOsirisFlag UND_ArcaneTower_MainPowerOn

AD_GalePowerRestored.synopsis: The Arcane Tower has been powered again.
AD_GalePowerRestored.how_to_trigger: Go to the Arcane Tower Generator(S_UND_ArcaneTower_Generator_dc8f6966-c4e1-4625-96dc-39caf1960ffd) and power it up by putting a Sussur Bloom in, with Gale nearby.

Automaton.synopsis: This is an old robot guarding the top of a deserting tower. His master programmed him to speak in verse. He talks mostly in iambic pentameter (though sometimes in iambic hexameter) - think shakespearian verse.Translator node: this dialogue is linked to other poems in the game, and uses the same words. For more information, please read the 'Riddles and word puzzles of note' doc!
Automaton.how_to_trigger: - loadlevel WLD_Main_A - oe und_arcane_poems (optional – do this if you want to unlock knowledge of the poems/passphrases)- goto -26.9, 52.2, -283.7

AD_GaleEntrance.synopsis: Gale enters the Arcane Tower for the first time
AD_GaleEntrance.how_to_trigger: Approach the Underdark Arcane Tower with Gale.

AD_GalePowerRestored_0.speaker: Gale
AD_GalePowerRestored_0.text: Ingenious use of the magic in the tower's floral core. Though not ingenius enough to outsmart Gale of Waterdeep.
AD_GalePowerRestored_0.context: NodeContext: His hypothesis proved correct. Respecting the ingenuity, but smug that he/the party was able to disable it

Automaton_10.speaker: Narrator
Automaton_10.text: *The automaton stands lifeless before you, gears silent, head low and heavy.*
Automaton_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: The automaton's head is hanging down, but it's still standing otherwise.InternalNodeContext: Automaton is deactivated by antimagic field

Automaton_24.speaker: Bernard
Automaton_24.text: New sounds through damp and dark oppression break / Is it the foe, that foul, contemptuous heel?
Automaton_24.context: NodeContext: He delivers his lines, then waits expectantly.

Automaton_30.speaker: Narrator
Automaton_30.text: *You know these words - they are from the opening stanza of a play you found in this very tower.*

Automaton_35.speaker: Player
Automaton_35.text: 'Or art thou friend, a rescue from my lonely wake?'

Automaton_2.speaker: Bernard
Automaton_2.text: Come out of love for me, not love for blood and steel...
Automaton_2.context: NodeContext: He bows, then waits, head stil bowed. Beat while still bowed, then looks at you expectantly. He straightens back up, not really knowing what to do.

Automaton_6.speaker: Player
Automaton_6.text: Out of my way. I'm not interested in riddles.

Automaton_1.speaker: Bernard
Automaton_1.text: An unbeknownst command by fools that would intrude.
Automaton_1.context: NodeContext: The automaton has received an unknown command - he's still in protect mode, so he's getting ready to kill the intruder who gave a wrong command.

Automaton_21.speaker: Bernard
Automaton_21.text: Now steel shall ring: false tongue will speak no more!

Automaton_45.speaker: Player
Automaton_45.text: I'm a friend. I come in peace.

Automaton_28.speaker: Player
Automaton_28.text: I'm not foul or contemptuous, but I am a foe.

Automaton_40.speaker: Player
Automaton_40.text: Attack it while it waits for an answer.

Automaton_33.speaker: Bernard
Automaton_33.text: Command as you see fit, my lord, my liege.

Automaton_12.speaker: Gale
Automaton_12.text: Don't get me wrong. I love poetry as much as the next wizard, but using it to command an automaton... seems a bit self-indulgent to me.
Automaton_12.context: NodeContext: Annoyed he didn't think of it

Automaton_37.speaker: Player
Automaton_37.text: 'How can I trust? How will I ever know? / How can I show myself, my darkest me?'

Automaton_48.speaker: Bernard
Automaton_48.text: If you do not your deepest secrets show? / Reveal your truth, give what you wish to see.
Automaton_48.context: NodeContext: The automaton repeats the lines, then bows and turns away.

Automaton_14.speaker: Player
Automaton_14.text: 'These empty sheets are all that's left of you. / The last of all the thoughtless gifts you gave.'

Automaton_26.speaker: Bernard
Automaton_26.text: I will hold onto them; it's all that I can do. / I can't throw them away; I've never been that brave.

Automaton_13.speaker: Bernard
Automaton_13.text: My fault, my fault - I've nothing left to give.
Automaton_13.context: NodeContext: The robot is silent and pats his thighs, as if trying to find out if his pockets are empty, then bows several times, flustered. pause while patting down pockets

Automaton_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: The automaton gives the player a gift offscreen (still unknown what the gift is, probably something small, like  a potion.

Automaton_47.speaker: Player

Automaton_42.speaker: Bernard
